Written and illustrated by : Sarra Ben Amara

Once upon a time, in a dense forest, there lived a
clever little fox named Felix. Felix was known for his
sharp mind and keen observation skills. He loved
exploring the forest and learning new things every
day.

One sunny morning, Felix saw a squirrel struggling to
reach a high branch to gather some acorns. Felix
quickly thought of a plan and gathered some fallen
branches to make a small ladder. The squirrel was
grateful and thanked Felix for his clever idea.

after that day, Felix heard a commotion near the river.
A group of animals was arguing about how to cross
the river safely. Some suggested swimming, while
others thought of building a raft. Felix quietly
observed the situation and noticed a fallen tree lying
across the river. He pointed it out to the animals, who
then used it as a bridge to cross safely.

Felix's ability to observe and think before acting made
him a valuable friend to all the animals in the forest.
He never boasted about his cleverness but always
used it to help others.

As days passed, Felix continued to help his friends
and learned something new every day. He watched
the birds build their nests, the ants work together to
gather food, and the bees create honeycombs. The
more he observed, the wiser he became.

Remember
Take time to observe and think
before acting. Helping others
and using your intelligence
wisely can make a big
difference.

Join Felix, the clever little fox, on his adventures in the forest!
Felix uses his sharp mind to help his friends, like building a ladder for a squirrel and
finding a bridge to cross a river. This heartwarming tale shows how wisdom and
kindness can make a big difference.
Perfect for young readers, "The Clever Little Fox" is a delightful story about
friendship and clever thinking.
